meaning: Yahweh contends / Yahweh will contend / plead
notes: First in the rotation; mentioned in some post-Temple liturgical poems.

famous_people.name: Flavius Josephus
famous_people.notes: Jewish-Roman historian (c. 37â€“100 CE). Claimed descent from the Jehoiarib division. Also descended from the Hasmonean dynasty through his mother.

famous_people.name: Mattathias
famous_people.notes: Priest who initiated the Maccabean Revolt against the Seleucid Empire (c. 167 BCE). Ancestor of the Hasmonean dynasty.

famous_people.name: Judas Maccabeus
famous_people.notes: Son of Mattathias. Military leader of the Maccabean Revolt, known for rededicating the Temple (origin of Hanukkah).

famous_people.name: Jonathan Apphus
famous_people.notes: Son of Mattathias. Succeeded Judas as leader and high priest.

famous_people.name: Simon Thassi
famous_people.notes: Son of Mattathias. First Hasmonean to be high priest and ethnarch, founder of the independent Hasmonean kingdom.

famous_people.name: John Hyrcanus I
famous_people.notes: Son of Simon. Hasmonean high priest and ruler who expanded Judean territory.

famous_people.name: Aristobulus I
famous_people.notes: Son of John Hyrcanus. First Hasmonean to take the title of king.

famous_people.name: Alexander Jannaeus
famous_people.notes: Hasmonean king and high priest known for his conquests and conflicts with the Pharisees.

meaning: From the right hand / right-handed / favored

notes: Famous due to Zechariah (father of John the Baptist) serving in this division (Luke 1:5,8); his week of service is linked to traditions about Jesus' birth timing.

famous_people.name: Zechariah
famous_people.notes: Father of John the Baptist. Priest who served in the Temple and received the annunciation of his son's birth (Luke 1:5).

notes: Name shares form with "Joshua"/Yeshua (Jesus in Greek).

meaning: Yahweh has dwelt / neighbor / dwelling of Yahweh
God restores / God will restore / repay
notes: A high priest named Eliashib is mentioned in Nehemiah (post-exile), possibly connected to this family.

meaning: He will raise up / Yahweh establishes
The father dwells / dwelling of the father

notes: Shares name with the prophet Ezekiel.

meaning: Yahweh is a refuge / counsel of Yahweh
